intro: Cucurbita ficifolia f. leucosperma, commonly known as the white-fruited bitter gourd, is a botanical variant of the bitter gourd species. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white, elongated fruits that are typically 15–30 cm in length. The plant is a perennial vine with heart-shaped leaves and tendrils, typical of the Cucurbitaceae family. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female blooms, and it produces a distinctive, mildly bitter taste. This variety is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
